args.natural_language_statement: Translate: Suppose f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚ is holomorphic on the open unit disk and maps the disk to itself (i.e. |f(z)| < 1 whenever |z| < 1), and f(0)=0. Then |f(z)| â‰¤ |z| for all z with |z| < 1. Produce a Lean4 theorem (no proof) using IsHolomorphicOn and Metric.ball (the open unit disk as Metric.ball (0 : â„‚) 1). End with := by sorry.

Produce a Lean4 theorem (no proof) using IsHolomorphicOn and Metric.ball (the open unit disk as Metric.ball (0 : â„‚) 1). End with := by sorry. -/
theorem schwarz_lemma_ext (f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚) (hf : IsHolomorphicOn f (ball 0 1)

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
Schwarz lemma: If f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚ is holomorphic on the open unit disk and maps the disk
into itself, and f(0) = 0, then |f(z)| â‰¤ |z| for all z in the open unit disk.
-/

open Complex Metric

theorem schwarz_lemma {f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚}
  (hf : IsHolomorphicOn f (Metric.ball (0 : â„‚) 1))
  (hmap : âˆ€ z, z âˆˆ Metric.ball (0 : â„‚) 1 â†’ f z âˆˆ Metric.ball (0 : â„‚) 1)
  (h0 : f 0 = 0) :
  âˆ€ z, z âˆˆ Metric.ball (0 : â„‚) 1 â†’ Complex.abs (f z) â‰¤ Complex.abs z := by sorry
